author: André Martins
description: Clean sound; with Modulation and Delay option on foot #1. Strat tone.
title: Klean Pedalboard + REV + MOD + DLY

author: Zenpoolzone
description:
We always need a  good tremolo and country guitar sound in our pedal rig. This board emulates the famous guitar tone from Nashville.

With a subtle touch of slap back echo and tube amp, it'll make your humbucker pick ups sound like this recognizable guitar tone.

Style: Country, Classic Rock, Country Rock,
title: Zenpoolzone | Nashville Tremolo

author: Zenpoolzone
description:
This is an emulation of the Chorus/delay guitar sound of the  80's guitar-era. And also the unique sound of jazz guitar virtuoso Mike Stern who played with the great Miles Davis.  

This chorus/delay is the trademark of a vast range of pop/rock hit tracks of this incredible period. Just think about The Police, Simple Minds, The Fixx, A Flock of Seagulls and many more. 

Style: 80's pop/rock, 80's Fusion jazz
title: Zenpoolzone | 80's Chorus/delay

author: Elesimo
description: Dreamy post-rock downtempo tones for people who like Tycho.
title: Gokotta

author: Kleber K. Shima
description: Stevie Ray!!!
title: Simulator - Fender SRV

author: Kleber K. Shima
description: Shima Uta - Okinawa Song
title: Simulator - Fender Vibro

author: Kleber K. Shima
description: Eric Johnson's Tone
title: Simulator - Fender Clean

author: christian
description: blues trechera ao reverbis
title: Big Muff CAPS Guitar

author: Lucas Zawacki
description: A good clean and crunch sound for rock and blues together with a delay and a reverse delay pedal that can be switch on and off with the foot switches. Now without beta plugins.
title: Fun With Reverse Delay

author: GMaq
description: I always use my MOD with a tube amp but with the simulation capabilities I thought I'd do my best to make an amp simulator set up in case my amp ever died at a gig that would enable me to plug in to the PA System and get a convincing replacement sound. The demo features the responsiveness of the DT-1, it behaves very much like a tube amp in response to playing dynamics.
title: SHIT! MY AMP BROKE!

author: brusch
description:
This is my  pedalboard for playing bass in a crust band. 
Output 1 is connected to a (power) amp, Output 2 is used for a direct signal to a mixer.
It is a heavily distorted sound. I am using the GxSVT for the foundation and an Octave shifted AmpVTS Bassman for the distortion. 
The Capo is high on resources, so I am not as flexible as I wish I was (e.g. for putting a Tubescreamer  or another distortion in front of the AmpVTS)
title: Distorted Bass Biamp SVT/Bassman

author: treelemon
description: This is the pedalboard that I rigged up for my bass. It is "bassed" on my former pedalboard which had lots of pedals on it.  I will likely make further tweaks to it, but I'm very satisfied with it for now. (I do all EQ through my amp).
title: Main Pedal board setup

author: Camille
description: Synth sound based on the synth used by Mac Demarco in the song: Chamber of Reflection. A warm, detuned sound with a lot of depth, giving a homely feel in these dark times. The tones fade out even when the keys are pressed. This makes it useful for chord progressions where small overlaps are permitted. The warmness of the sound really blends in when changing chords.
title: SYN: Detune and Demarco

author: Claudius
description: Boost, TS, DS-1, Muff, Reverb + footswitch
title: GTR: Rockbesteck

author: Claudius
description: royal blood beginner setup
title: octave fun

author: Claudius
description: + footswitch
title: Boost,Dist, Fuzz,Echo,Reverb

author: Marius Janssen aka mj_prod
description: This pedalboard contains the new ShiroVerbMkII which is absolutely nice! Although I do not use that much shimmer I need a verb that paints a wall of sound. Looking in the audio  plugins world  for your host you will find Vintage Reverb and Shimmer reverb from valhalladsp.com  This might be not the same like these or Eventide Space, but definitely try it out!
title: ShiroVerbMkII_GXComp_ParaEQ_MJ

author: Marius Janssen aka mj_prod
description:
FluidGM AcousticGrandPiano and ElectricGrandPiano with EQ settings (to make them sound a bit better) with a small amount of Tubewarmth and MVerb.
Footswitch1 changes Pedalboard presets (EQ and soundfont), Knob1 switches between FluidGM programs, FS2 turns MVerb on/off. Have fun!
title: KEY-FluidGM E+A Grand

author: Camille
description: Percussive Bass sound based on the song 'Get Innocuous', by LCD Soundsystem. The Square Wave LFO makes this instrument sound like a repetitive bass machine. It has got a punchy feel to it, caused by the compressed and equalized bass patterns.
title: SYN: Perc Bass

author: Jesse
description: A blues guitarist's workstation pedalboard, including amplifier and cabinet simulators. Enjoy the warm and welcoming Bassman-inspired sounds with a touch of reverb. Engage the Guitarix Tube Screamer for more dirt, and enable the Clean Boost for increased volume. The Clean Boost also makes your guitar signal hit the amplifier harder, adding that subtle touch of drive.
title: GTR: Blues Clues

author: Camille lieser
description: A basic clavinet sound that can be spiced up for more funky-ness! Engage the Autowah for that classic funky quack, and set the Peak and Depth parameters to choose your particular flavour. There is also a switchable, characterful, single-repeat delay, taken care of by the SHIRO Modulay.
title: KEY: Wonderbar!

author: Camille Lieser
description:
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Sound like dark pop queen Lorde with this pedalboard. A reverb and a harmonizer create a wide, spacey sound for you to get lost in. Choose the perfect intervals on the harmonizer to give your vocals extra depth. Use the beautiful plate reverb to add a dash of ambience, or completely drown the vocals in it for that smooth, washy sound.

This is one of the many new built-in pedalboards that come shipped with the latest version of the MOD Duo. Now, it is available to everyone!
----------------------------------------------------------------------
title: VOC: Lorde-In-Space

author: Mr Noo
description: Touch responsive grind for bass. Nice and even across the neck.
title: TriFuzz

author: ssj71
description: Quick delay, thick reverb, stereo amps with the infamous stuck stacker on switch 2 toggling a tremolo'd octave drone that fades in/out using the GxSlowGear. Its stereo madness!
title: Thick Pulse

author: Zenpoolzone
description:
Thought to be use in a DI recording context, this dual amp configuration has practically the same configuration. A compressor on one side, a tube screamer on the other.

The EQs on each amps have been adjusted to produce  a better definition of the notes of a chord, to enhance clarity to each guitar pickups selections, add some warmth to the sound. Plus a touch of reverb to emulate different rooms will help to slightly broaden out the sound of the instrument. Finally, why don't use this setup by re-amping a track in your home studio? 

Style: DI recording, Re-amping, Blues lead, funk grooves
title: GTR: Zenpoolzone | Red Warm Peppers

author: Camille
description:
A Neo-psychedelic poly sound which has a retro 80's feel to it. Based on one of the synths used in the Tame Impala album "Currents". Starts rather sharp, but develops into a crisp but soothing synth sound with more emphasis on the low and mid frequencies of the tones. Has a sustain of medium length, making it great for percussive synth playing with a tail of low volume fragments of the played notes.

This is one of the many new built-in pedalboards that come shipped with the latest version of the MOD Duo. Now, it is available to everyone!
title: SYN: Tame Chords

description:
Ambient "Call and Response" type of Effect. Perfect to create a Post-Rock kind of enigmatic moods and textures or a guitar instrumental break in a Trippy context groove.  Using an E-Bow and you'll emulate and get the feel a Cello quartet. 

Style: Film or Video Production, Live Electronics improvisation, Post-rock mood
title: GTR:  Zenpoolzone | St Benoit Abbaye

author: Jesse
description:
I'm using the Duo to process the Novation Circuit groovebox.

The Circuit is sending beats to input 1. These are then  sent to a compressor to make them a bit more snappy. It is possible to mix the MDA subsynth in with the compressed signal with the Stereo X-fade. The same plugin also allows us to bypass the subsynth entirely. Then, the CAPS Wider plugin pans the beat very narrow in the center for a more clear seperation between beats and synths. Finally, this signal is fed into the MVerb with a similar dry/wet + bypass construction using the stereo X-fade. 

On input 2, the Circuit is sending synths. These are first panned very wide, to contrast the beat which is panned very narrow. Afterwards, there is the famous stereo x-fade dry/wet + bypass construction on the Calf Phaser, followed by the same construction but with the MVerb.
title: Groovebox Master FX

author: Jesse
description:
I'm using the Duo to process the audio coming out of the Novation Circuit (synths + beats). The Invada Compressor and Calf Saturator are used to add punch and warmth.

At the same time the Duo is used as a (very fancy) USB MIDI host. Data from a MIDI keyboard is processed and sent to the Circuit over two different channels: 

Ch1: controls the bass-synth
Ch2: controls the strummy chords

The bottom MIDI chain transforms the note played on the bass synth into a chord that is 3 octaves up from the bass note, and strums that chord in a rhythmic fashion.
title: The Missing Link

author: Jesse
description:
This pedalboard transforms any incoming audio (on input 1) into a big detuned synth sound. The phaser adds to the throbbing sound, while the delay makes the sound more spacious.

Changing the octave parameter to 0 allows you to play polyphonically, whereas -1 and -2 allow you to go down very LOOOOOW!
title: [Innovation Day] Audio-Synth

All of the pedals need addressing to midi buttons on whatever controller you're using, and I'd advise replacing the compressor with the Calf MultiBand that's in the unstable section... Enjoy!

2 channels. 
channel 1: 'clean sound' with subtle overdrive.
channel 2: Combination of a Tube Screamer and 2 Fuzzes to create a hard but creamy distortion

From Out 1 into my MF-101 (Moogerfooger Lowpass Filter) and back into the Mod for some sidechain action.

(This is just a test. Intended for bass clarinet)

author: Solobasssteve
description: A Regen delay, using Bollie delays and Shiroverbs in series to get an octave up with each new layer. Also a clean path on the side. Use a volume pedal or eBow to swell notes into the  pad sound, loop it with the looper then switch to the clean side... You'll need to address a lot of the controls with MIDI. Have fun!

author: Paolo Valente
description:
Another version of the "PV - Guitar Practice" pedalboard. 
I adjusted the guitar sound, changed the sounds of the generated instruments and modified the MIDI stuff a bit to get a lydian harmony. 
Knob#1 is assigned to some parameters of the guitar sound. 
Knob#2 controls the level of each instrument and the BPM. 
Enjoy :)
title: PV - Guitar Practice {Lydian}

author: Paolo Valente
description:
Hi there! 
I thought it would be cool to practise some scales using a backing track instead of just a click, so I made a little one with the Step Sequencer.
- All instruments are generated by one sequence, which makes it easy to adjust the BPM as needed and leaves some room for adding stuff (CPU usage 64%). 
- Knob#1 is assigned to some parameters of the guitar sound.
- Knob#2 controls the level of the each instrument and the BPM.
Have fun! :)
title: PV - Guitar Practice {Minor}

description: Ac/dc
title: crunch drop

author: Ian Rogerson
description: My main general purpose pedalboard for using with the Chapman Stick (focusing on the bass player role).  Lots of tone options on the bass side with some fat midi bass for those dance tunes!

author: Rogério Couto
description:
Same pedalboard as the previous one but now with a dry/wet chorus mix control, assigned to knob #1.
To obtain a correct mix I used the "stereo x-fade" plugin with a gain plugin set to -3db in front of it to control the dry signal and another gain plugin after it set to +3db to compensate the losses of the "CS Chorus 2", 
The fade type on the "Stereo X-Fade" is set to "equal power".
I also organised the pedals to better reflect the the saved pedalboard presets.
title: Love is all you need #2 [rogeriocouto.com.br]

author: Solobasssteve
description: it uses a CC pedal assigned to the pan pedal to cross fade between two paths - one for big ambience and one for a bass part with two overdrives and tremolo.
title: dual path ambience/bass with two loopers

author: JEL
description:
Finally, a Slicer or Chopper or whatever you call it! I've been looking around for a slicer effect for a long time and finally decided to handcraft my own artisinal bespoke pedal! Only can a platform like the Mod Duo offer you this kind of creativity.

The only addition needed is to get a tap tempo added. I added in the RePsycho as a last pedal but it's turned off by default. I think it's a little too much, but it could be cool to turn on as the signal decays for additional effect. Btw, the decay on this is ridiculous.

Enjoy!
title: Ginsu Slicer

author: JEL
description:
Update to my "line" of ambient pedals! This version is the evolution of how I've been using my Mod Duo: primarily as an ambient pedal, but secondarily as a boost. This version has a "pure" boost that doesn't change the flavor of your amp, whereas the previous versions used a tube screamer that was a little too sharp on the high end. 

It has the same principle as previous versions where Footswitch A toggles the ambient effects, and Footswitch B toggles the boost coming from the direct stereo signal. I simplified the signal chain so that there is always a clean signal going through the pedal so you always have a clean attack, and the boost can be used in addition to or in lieu of the ambient effects.

I added a compressor to the front as well so the ambient effects don't swell too loud... this results in a lot of noise reduction as well as lower CPU usage.  Enjoy!
title: Swell & Pure Boost

author: Skydiver
description: Blending a clean bass sound (using amp/cab sim) with a synth. Using the Sonuus G2M for note to Midi conversion. Played on the bass side of the NS/Stick.

author: Rogério Couto
description:
Simple all purpose plug and play guitar pedalbord. 
With no amp or cab simulators this pedalboard should  go in front of a clean channel of an All tube amplifier.
(The sound samples here are just a reference of the different sounds you can get from this pedalboard.)
With the pedalboard presets addressed to MOD footswitch #1 is possible to switch between the different sounds. 
With MOD Footswitch #2 you can turn the reverb on and off.
With Knobs #1 and #2 is possible access a number of other parameters of some of the effects.
Have fun!
title: Love is all you need

If you are playing slower a longer downtime on GxSlowGear will make it better, and getting the threshold in the right place is quite critical too.

author: Dwek
description:
Analogue to the Vocals Interior pedalboard, for boosting vocals when playing at open air venues.

Compressor with vocal leveller preset, eq (addressed to knob 1), fractal doubler (with tracking controls on knob2) and reverb (controls on knob 2).

author: Dwek
description:
Vocal boosting pedalboard with compressor with vocal leveller preset, eq (with levels on knob1), fractal doubler (with tracking on knob2) and delay (with tap tempo on footswitch1 and bypass on footswitch2).

I use it for singing with a samba group and a bossa/jazz duet with an acoustic 7-string guitar.

I've made a similar one with a reverb instead of the delay, for exterior gigs.

author: JEL
description:
Everything a multi-layered guitarist needs in their arsenal: a succulent and smooth shimmer swell pad on one path, and a shrieking shrill boost on another path that cuts through the mix like a Japanese ginsu knife! 

The best part is that there's a 4-way toggle switch at the start of the chain that allows the source signal to constantly flow, but the 1st and 4th switches toggle either the pad or the boost (or BOTH if you want the NUCLEAR option!). This allows the guitarist to cut the pad or boost, but results in the pad's trails to remain in the mix as the source signal never changes.

Putting together this pedalboard has convinced me of the amazing utility of the Mod Duo. Special thanks to Gianfranco for the boost - I got it early on, but forget what he named it.
title: Swell Boost

author: Pascal Glanville
description: My main Chapman Stick Mod Duo pedalboard for small gigs. Treble and Bass inputs of the Stick into inputs 1 and 2. With both sides effected separately  in Parallel for ambience and a Bollie Delay on switch 1 with tap tempo on switch 2 for the treble side. All merged to 1 output.

Control the larynx with k1/s1 and the panning with k2/s2.

Let me know what you think, and any improvements you could imagine.

Two different channels: I use the fuzz channel with the e-bow and a lot of compression to obtain a Adrian Belew sound. The second channel has a lot delay and shimmer, to have almost a sinth pad tone with chords.
I use toggleswitch to have one channel selected (or all two if needed); can't use switchbox because if I try to load it in the pedalboard of my ModDuo it still crash the system (sigh!)

Knob 1 controls speed of the Leslie effect on the Melody side. Using the "Toggle" Preset on the SoftStep, switch one controls distortion on the melody side, switch two controls leslie on the melody side, and switch three controls c chorus for both sides.

author: Skydiver
description:
This is my general pedalboard for my NS/Stick. Ch1 is Bass side and Ch2 is Melody Side. 
I use the X-Fade to blend the "clean" melody sound and a "dirty" melody sound. 
Use a lot of parallel signals and blending.

author: Jeremy Cubert
description: This pedalboard provides a clean sound for both melody and bass sides of a Chapman Stick of NS Stick with a little reverb. Footswitch 1 controls a rotary effect for the melody side and Footswitch 2 adds a chorus effect to the bass side.

author: Klaas von Karlos (ReVerse Bullets)
description:
God

Live and direct from Stockholm where we are hard at work on the new ReVerse Bullets album.  Gritty drums are key for the RvB sound, and using the MOD has made the process of find the right sound even better.  Check out this simple patch I made in which the drums are sourced from a Step Sequencer triggered the Novation Launchpad in Ableton Live 


Keep up with the progress of the album sessions at 



https://www.instagram.com/klaasvonkarlos/
https://www.facebook.com/reversebullets/

title: Crunch with Clean Ambience

author: Solobasssteve
description: This is an updated version of the board I used on the track 'This Is Not The End', that's on YouTube (search for Steve Lawson + the title) - F/S 2 switches between the two sides of the chain, and I've got the overdrive, phaser and delay assigned to midi controls, as well as the controls for the looper...
title: dual channel bleepy ambience and overdriven lead

author: broupe
description: lots of sounds, lots of fun..
title: BR - RingM-Scream-Loop

author: JEL
description: Version 2 of my shimmer/swell pedalboard. Easily pull of ambient swells using your volume pedal, or pluck single notes intermittently for stronger clearer attacks for simple solos.
title: Shimmer2

author: Munsha
description: two mic one vocal game
title: evening pulse

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description:
Some quick jamming for pre-lunch fun!!!
Plugged the gret JCM-800 to a cabinet and added the Phaser for a funky vibe.
The very basic drum is provided by x42's MIDI sequencer coupled to the FluidDrums. 
Looped everything to jam with myself a bit :-)
title: Early Jamming

author: Jesse
description:
By connecting the DIN-MIDI output to the DIN-MIDI input, we can change the MIDI messages we are receiving, and use them for different plugins.

In this board, we duplicate CC14 to CC44 to control two parameters at once (width of the pingpong panner and the depth of shiro harmless).

We also transpose the note an octave down and an octave up.

Try it out and get creative!
title: MIDI Loopback

author: domlo
description:
Playing a bass patch with optional +3/-3, close to "Shine" by "The Cool Quest".
MODs CPU at it's max :)
title: Shine

author: mat
description: first try with MODDuo. I tried to get a kind of "money for nothing"  tone. intended for headphones output : I havn't tried on a real amp.
title: money for something

author: Rogério Couto
description: just a short test
title: GXJCM800Test

author: GMaq
description: Organ player can't make the gig? No MIDI keyboard? No problem! MOD Duo to the rescue with the setBfree 'Whirl' speaker Leslie emulation. To fake organ sounds roll back the tone on your rhythm pickup and play fingerstyle with lots of high drone notes. Don't forget if you do have a MIDI keyboard you can emulate the real Hammond B3 thing with the setBfree organ generator, this pedalboard is for faking it with a guitar.
title: OD-Leslie

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description:
Trying out the JCM-800 and the Shiro Harmless modulator.
Such a beautiful sound!!!
title: Harmless JCM

author: Jumi
description: Experiments with sequencers, and voice.
title: Uoyhtiw

author: Jumi
description: AC30, delay, reverbs !
title: In the arms of

author: Jumi
description: Reverbery ac30 and jcm. + having fun with whammied voice (like in the Knife ;) )
title: The Knifes

author: Freaked
description: Just an experiment
title: midistuffDemo

author: Migle M
description: First attempt with synthesizers and keyboard on MOD Duo. I think I found a new favorite thing.
title: Synthesizers can make music

author: Jesse
description:
Using the new Harmless by Shiro, combined with the Larynx on my Novation Circuit.

Also using the new Guitarix VibroChump, spiced up by the TAP Tubewarmth for a warmer sound. The Shiroverbs are set to octave down and octave up for very different shimmer sounds.
title: ShimmerMachine

author: Yan
description:
Acostumando com o Loop, da pra fazer muita coisa com isso ....Lindo!
Musica Segredos - Trem de Carga
title: Loop + harmonicos

author: Jesse
description:
I'm using the Novation Circuit as a MIDI-controller for the MOD Duo. 
The Duo has great MIDI-filtering capabilities, so I filtered the individual sequenced tracks and hooked them up to a drummachine, bass-synth and e-piano.
title: CircuitJam

author: Adam John Williams
description: Great for testing speakers because it generates an extremely wide range of frequencies. Sit on your subwoofer.
title: Epic Strummed Synth

author: Klaas von Karlos (ReVerse Bullets)
description:
The pedal combination of Chorus/Flanger and Cabinet give a warm, thick distortion while still leaving space for lingering frequencies to fit amongst the deep low end.

I mostly recently used this pedalboard for a new song with RJ Thyme. Check it out below:

https://soundcloud.com/rjthyme/god-is-music-feat-klaas-von-karlos
title: Cottonmouth Lives

author: GMaq
description: I was looking to emulate my Boss OC-3 Pedal which features both Octave and fuzz, I tried the MOD Guitarix OC-2 emulation and the MOD MDA-Subsynth but both were pretty messy and lost tracking pretty quickly especially when playing fast. I was able to utilize the 2Voices plugin with the Tubescreamer and get a righteous Octave fuzz that tracks nicely. 2Voices is set to have 'Step1' dropped an octave and Step2 retains the original actual pitch. Unfortunately there was not enough spare CPU to record a sample.
title: OD-Octave

author: Roman Gerold
description: Feed this patch seconds of signal and enjoy it for hours. Set up as a send effect.
title: Endless

author: Roman Gerold
description: A kind of maximalistic reverb. Set up as a send effect.
title: Deep Well

author: Roman Gerold
description: Voices from somewhere above our heads pick up your signal and sing with you. ;) Set up as a send effect.
title: Above Our Heads

author: Rogério Couto
description:
Clean sounds for rhythm guitar.
In this one I added a little bit of compression to the dry signal and a gain control to the chorus signal.
http://www.rogeriocouto.com.br
title: Chorus Maniac (clean funk gtr)

author: André Martins
description: A clean patch with some nice reverb.
title: Klean Aula #1

author: Deparra

data.name: Pink Floyd - shine on you crazy diamond

description: I tried as much as possible to make the same sound
title: Pink Floyd - shine on you crazy diamond

author: Rogério Couto
description: Just a some tools to use with my students
title: Mixer, Reverb and Click [rogeriocouto.com.br]

author: Robin
description: Fun with step-sequencer & MIDI utils -- jam along
title: C major accompaniment

author: jerash
description: dual path crunchy sond with a crossover upfront and stereo spread on output
title: crossX3

author: RJ Thyme
description: Gives fullness and distortion to any simple waveform, be it saw, sine, square, etc
title: Wave Transformer

author: Skydiver
description:
I got a Sonuus G2M to play the Fluid Synth Pad in the background with my bass side on the NS/Stick. 

Also using parallel compression which keeps the pure direct sound and blend it the compressed, more sustained note. Adds nice tone. 

Issue with Fluid Synth Pad... It causes CPU usage to sway from 30% to 100% causing digital clipping. You can hear it in this recording...
title: Strings B/D

author: Jesse
description:
This pedalboard is meant to show the difference between filtered and unfiltered octave-up sounds. Like every instance of adding effects to your sound: consider the mix wisely!

1. unfiltered
2. filtered
3. unfiltered + dry 
4. filtered + dry
5. unfiltered + dry
6. filtered + dry
title: filteredCapo

author: Solobasssteve
description: a first go at getting an artefact-free octave up, with the whammy assigned to a CC pedal. Will experiment more with the lofi settings for greater post processing options!
title: First pitch shift attempt

author: Jesse
description:
This pedalboard shows how the whammy can enhance the sound of the ePiano by adding octave up/down effects with smooth transitions between these sounds. 

The pedalboard also showcases one of the fun things you can do with the whammy; by setting it really close to the input pitch, you can get a really great chorus sound. (try it with a guitar too, it's very nice!)
title: ePianoWhammy

author: Migle M
description:
Finally, we released the pitch-shifters! You can get amazing sounds like this one, sounds like you have few voices!  Here's my attempt at DubFX song The rain is gone.
I also had a 2Voices effect before the loop, but it took a lot of CPU so I had to remove it before the recording. The voice in the looper has the 2Voices. 
And in there's a cut because I ran out of time ;)
title: Rain is gone with pitch-shifters

author: Jesse
description: This pedalboard shows how the whammy can transform a guitar into a weird space-gun-sounding device. It also shows how the lo-fi mode can be used to get a really nasty double octave up sound.
title: SuperWhammy!

author: Nino
description: Really liking the SlowGear!
title: swell

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: A simple 7 semitone pitch up in parallel with the dry signal is enough for me ;-)
title: the Good Ol Fifth

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: I love pitch shifters!!!!
title: Very low and heavy guitar

author: Klaas von Karlos (ReVerse Bullets)
description:
Hey Mod Community -

This is my first patch.
I love the thickness and clarity of these two together. This simple setup of the Korg Volca Keys and the MOD make for a massively dense and dark sound that I love. :)




I used this simple patch for a demo currently titled as "Replikant." Check it out!

https://soundcloud.com/reverse-bullets/replikant-kvk-mod-duo-demo
title: WAHECHO KVK (Perfect Entropy / GLITCH Label Patch 1)

author: Jesse
description: Inspired by Tame Impala, having the phaser and reverb in front of the gain pedals. This gives you a lo-fi sound that cuts through the mix quite nicely.
title: Not-so-tame Impala

author: RJ Thyme
description: Adds depth and fullness to any simple waveform be it saw, sine, square, etc.
title: Wave Transformer

author: Solobasssteve
description:
Using the 'shimmer' in the Shiroverb as a pitch-shifter. It's pretty glitchy, in a really cool way, and produces artifacts that sound like vinyl crackle :) 

The shimmer pitch is assigned to a CC pedal, and the tube screamer, tremolo and delay are all controlled via midi
title: Makeshift Pitchshift

author: Solobasssteve
description: A split channel patch with a clean side for melody and a bleepy spacey side for ambience. Feed the ambient side with a volume pedal, and assign MIDI on/off to the shimmer/reflector/reverb :)
title: AmbiBleep Dual Channel

author: Solobasssteve
description: Sharing to show the clicks that happen when turning pedals on and off...
title: D Main Trem/Env/Chs

author: Jesse
description: Combining a rhythmic delay in parallel with my favorite reverb to get some big textures.
title: Ambient Guitar

author: Migle M
description: Was playing around with delays for the voice. I found the mirror effect really cool, even if you can't understand the lyrics anymore, it just sounds so interesting. Now I'm really excited about exploring more cool effects for the voice.
title: You were born yesterday - crazy delays

author: autostatic
description: Big shoutout to X42 and the MOD team! Hail thee step sequencer!
title: LazySundayEvening

author: larry w
description: tribute to the late great bernie worell moog sound for a bass guitar.
title: moog

author: Jesse
description: A phat, grinding big muff sound.
title: Phat Muff

author: Solobasssteve
description: a fairly subtle overdrive and tremolo, designed to have each of the pedals controlled via midi, and the reverb level controlled by assigning the 2nd stereo gain to a CC controller
title: Tremolo Overdrive 1

author: Jesse
description: Looped drum sounds to play over, octave down shimmer with the Shiroverb.
title: Ancient Vibes

author: putro
description: something similar to Pink Floyd sorrow sound
title: guitar sorrow #1

author: Jesse
description: Messing around with looped drumsounds and distortion + my favorite verb
title: DrumMachine

author: Jesse
description:
Disclaimer: Use headphones or a good subwoofer.

Using the fluid percussions with an extra emphasis on sub-bass with the Mverb and equalizer. 

Also using the Pink/fractal noise generator by TAP to get some background ambience going.
title: Sub-Bells

author: Rogério Couto
description:
Simple loop using the MOD DUO pedalboard.
For the melodic part the basic guitar tone was created with analog boosters and overdrive pedals before the MOD input. The MOD is responsable for the delay and reverb.
title: "New" End of FX Chain [rogeriocouto.com.br]

author: C0d3man (Holger)
description: MIDI-Split for Bass and E-Piano. Also Drums (on Ch 10), which I can't play for the sample with my current MIDI equipment.
title: EP/Bass/Drums

author: Pjotr Lasschuit
description: KalimbaSynth
title: Kalimbasynthjamm

author: Jesse
description: This pedalboard will give you access to looped drum sounds, a bass synth by  setting the Nekobi synth to -12 semitones, as well as a lead synth by setting the Nekobi synth to +12 semitones. Combined with the Prefreak reverb this board is  sure to give you some trippy soundscapes.
title: Freaky Travel Setup

author: Rogério Couto
description: This pedalboard is meant to replace the effect pedals at the end of the effects chain on my real pedalboard setup.
title: End of FX chain [rogeriocouto.com.br]

author: Skydiver
description:
This is designed for the NS/Stick. Bass side in channel 1 with bass eq up all the way and treble down all the way. Melody side into channel 2 w/ eq up the middle. I like to use both pickups for the bass side and use the neck pickup on melody side. 
Bass Side - Blend the treble-y (high-pass filter with a light fuzz) with nice round bass tone. 
Melody Side - nice sustaining notes with sustainer. Nice distortion. Nice clean tone too. Control the amount of reverb and delay.
title: Next Gen 2 rev2

author: Jesse
description: Beautiful clean sounds, reminiscent of oldschool tube amplifiers.
title: Lazy Thursday

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: Looping with the Tilt Tone and the Alembic Amplifier simulator.
title: Loop Tilt Tone

author: Guy Sherman
description: Load this pedal board, shake out your mullet, and transport yourself back to the 80's!
title: Mullet

author: Skydiver
description:
THIS PEDALBOARD HAS ISSUES.
Posted for MOD team to inspect. 
Bug report has been submitted. 
Plugins show default settings when GUI gets info from MOD. (Details in Bug report)

Designed for use with my NS/Stick. Channel 1 is for the bass side with bass EQ turned all the way up and treble EQ turned all the way down and blend a thin sound with the bassy tone on the pedalboard to taste.
Channel 2 is for Melody side of NS/Stick. Blend in Delay and Reverb to taste. Nice Clean tone. Change distortion to taste. Sustainer for nice long sustained notes for lead. 
I have switches in line for assigning to DUO switches and external Midi Switch (KM Softstep).
title: Next Gen 2

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: Feeding some traditional effects using the CAPS guitar combo - AmpVTS + Cabinet IV
title: CAPS Multi Effects

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: Driving the CAPS AmpVTS with the Open Big Muff and changing cabinet models for different tones.
title: Big Muff CAPS Guitar

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: Looping with the basic CAPS guitar setting. Changed cabinet models for looping and soloing. During the improvisation I also changed pickup the setting of the guitar.
title: CAPS Basic Guitar Loop

author: autostatic
description:
Basic harrdcore pedalboard based on a Mesa Boogie tonestack and a Mesa cab. Preamp section with 12AX7 pregain and 6V6 gain stages.

Recording played with a 1982 Gibson 335-S with Dirty Fingers pickups. Riff courtesy of McClane: https://yhc-mcclane.bandcamp.com/track/aging
title: BasicHardcore

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: Driving the AmpVTS with the great FOMP Auto Wah.
title: Wah CAPS Guitar

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini

title: CAPS Basic Guitar

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description:
Basic clean guitar sound based on the CAPS suite.
Changing the AmpVTS Tonestack to show different amp responses.

author: Guy Sherman
description:
Has a clean channel and a distorted channel. Might actually make sense to run both channels through the HPF to tighten up the bass in the distorted bit.

Designed with an Epiphone ES 339, Neck Pickup, Vol: 9, Tone: 4
title: Smashing Pumpkins - Today

author: Jeremy Jongepier
description:
Just a very basic clean amp setting with the amp about to break up which allows for dynamic playing.

Recording played with a 1970 Gibson SG Pro with P90's hence the hum, sorry about that.
title: CleanAmp

author: Leal
description: Testing the first pedal board with Gian setup.
title: Clean with Reverb

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: Using the FOMP Auto-Wah for the quacking effect and the great CAPS duo - AmpVTS + Cabinet IV - for shaping the guitar's sound.
title: Quacking like a duck

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: Jamming over a loop
title: Loop - Diego e Gian

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description: A tweaked version of Daniel Dickinson's great pedalboard.
title: Modified Everyday Crunch

author: Daniel Dickison
description:
This is my go-to rock/blues/country gigging patch for my telecaster played through a ZT Club or AC30 amp.

Footswitch 1 activates a boost for solos. Footswitch 2 toggles the slap delay. Knob 1 adjusts levels and gain, while knob 2 adjusts delay and reverb parameters to fit the room. Turning up the delay time to ~250ms also works for epic power ballad-style solos!
title: "Everyday" Crunch with Slap Delay

author: JEL
description:
Another Swell pedalboard for Ambience. This is primarily delay driven with the CAP pedal to add a little beat for interesting background effects. Make sure to use the volume pedal for the swell, or it's just overkill. 

Also, if you could tap in the beat that would put this over the top, but I don't think it's quite there yet. Also, I tried to reduce the feedback and time of the beat, but it sounds like the beat will keep playing in the background very subtly until the amp is muted.
title: That's just SWELL

author: Kleber K. Shima
description: The simulation of Don Leslie Rotary Speaker is awesome! MOD DUO: I can't live without it!
title: Leslie Rotary Speaker

author: Migle M
description: I really like delays and how some of the sounds are bouncing around. As well as that just simple guitar sound, with lower volume than the rest of the effects.
title: Spatial guitar sound with delays

author: JEL
description: MAXXed out Ambient sound. Recorded through my Kemper (Vox AC30 ) and used my volume pedal on the attack to create the pad sound. Lots of layers to create fullness of space and reverb. I added the looper in the pedalboard, but couldn't figure out the footswitches, so you can delete it or try it out yourself.
title: MAXX Ambience

author: Gianfranco Ceccolini
description:
Made for Diego :-)
Gianfranco and Pjotr improvising over a loop.

author: GMaq
description: Sick Big Muff Fuzz combined with Tubescreamer and sweetened with mild phasing for when you're craving a late 60's psychedelic fuzz fest.
title: Blues1 - Fuzz Toffee

author: 120dBRockNRoll
description: 3 channels: Clean, Rhythm & Solo (use footswitches 1 & 2), connect output 1  to flat response amp with guitar cab, connect output 2 to mixer or flat response amp with flat response cab, pickup used for setup: DiMarzio X2N DP102 on a Yamaha RGX312
title: 3-Channel Amp Metal
